sub_topic: Identifying the perfect matching in a graph.
message_2:
Yes, there is a perfect matching in this graph. A perfect matching is a set of edges that covers all vertices such that each vertex is connected to exactly one edge in the matching.

One possible perfect matching for this graph is:

{(1, 3), (2, 4), (5, 6)}

This matching covers all 6 vertices, and each vertex is connected to exactly one edge in the matching.
